intro: Centropogon scabellus, commonly known as the swamp lily, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Its leaves are broad and grass-like, and it produces a cluster of flowers at the top of a slender stem. Centropogon scabellus is an important species for wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and wildlife.
